core.title: Place of birth among immigrants in the Greater Boston region
core.shortDescription: Total population foreign-born aggregated to the Census tract level; geography covers Greater Boston region; time period covers 2016-2020 as a five-year average
core.fullDescription:
This data represents the foreign-born population living in the Greater Boston region. The data originates from the United States Census Bureau's American Community Survey. Downloaded from the Census data aggregator NHGIS, this dataset displays American Community Survey estimates (2016-2020) for foreign-born population by Census tract across the Greater Boston area, defined as all cities and towns in the Metropolitan Area Planning Commission's Inner Core Committee. 
 
 Field names in this dataset are opaque and can be parsed with the codebook.  
 
 This dataset is part of the LMEC's [Cartography Challenges](https://leventhalmap.org/projects/cartography-challenge).

access.title: Place of birth among immigrants in the Greater Boston region GeoJSON
Place of birth among immigrants in the Greater Boston region zipped shapefile
Place of birth among immigrants in the Greater Boston region CSV

ingredients.notes: Census tract geography from NHGIS was joined with Census tract tabular data from NHGIS

processing.steps:
1. Downloaded Census tract-level data for the data point `place of birth` within the Census-designated universe `foreign-born population` from NHGIS
2. In QGIS, tabular and spatial data were joined using the NHGIS field `GISJOIN`
3. An additional field was added describing total population per Census tract
4. All spatial and tabular data exceeding the MAPC ICC area, as well as irrelevant data fields, were manually removed

codebooks.title: Place of birth among immigrants in the Greater Boston region codebook
codebooks.notes: Lightly edited version of the default codebook generated by NHGIS data downloads.
